g.text: Nadir hemoglobulin during cardiopulmonary bypass: impact on
F. Ampatzidou , D. Moisidou , E. Dalampini, M. Nastou, E. Vasilarou,
V. Kalaizi, H. Chatzikostenoglou, G. Drossos
Aim of this study was to evaluate the impact of
low hemoglobulin (<7 g/dl) during cardiopulmonary bypass
(CPB) because of hemodilution, on postoperative mortality and
A total of 667 patients who underwent elective cardiac sur-
gery procedures under the use of CPB in our department during a
2 years period were retrospectively studied. The lowest value of
hemoglobulin (Nadir Hb) throughout CPB was recorded. Group A
consisted of patients with Hb < 7 g/dl, while group B was the control
group. The following perioperative outcome indices were compared
between 2 groups: Increase of Lactate (Lac) value at the end of CPB,
acute kidney injury (AKI) defined by RIFLE criteria, postoperative use
of non invasive ventilation (NIV), prolonged mechanical ventilation
(>48 hours), perioperative infarction (PMI), stroke, total red blood
transfusion > 3units, atrial fibrillation(AF) and mortality. Statistical ana-
lysis was based on chi-square test.
162 patients consist group A and 505 control group.
Optimal hemoglobulin during CPB has not been de-
fined. Severe hemodilutional anemia (Hb < 7 g/dl) has statistical sig-
nificant correlation with increase of Lac value at the end of CPB,
postoperative AKI, use of NIV, prolonged mechanical ventilation,
transfusion with >3 red blood cell units and has strong correlation
Red blood cell transfusion does not influence the prognostic value
of RDW in critically ill patients
Intensive Care Unit, University of Ferrara, Italy, Ferrara, Italy;
Department of Intensive Care, Erasme Hospital, Université Libre de
Some studies have found a correlation between in-
creased RDW and mortality in ICU patients. However, RDW values
can be increased by transfusion (RBCT), erythropoiesis or hemolysis.
In this study we investigated whether the prognostic value of RDW
was influenced by RBCT in ICU patients.
All patients admitted to ICU over 8 months were en-
rolled in the study. Patients were analyzed in two groups (A if
no RBCT was given and B receiving RBCT before ICU admission).
We measured RDW, reticulocyte index (RI) and haptoglobin on
admission and 48 h thereafter. RDW was categorized in tertiles:
changes in SOFA score and length of stay in ICU
102 patients were enrolled(64 in group A and 38 in
group B).Clinical variables are shown in Fig.
analysis shows that high RDW values were significantly associ-
higher level of RDW on admission (16.7 ± 2 % vs. 15.1 ± 2.2 %;
p = 0.03). Nevertheless, the accuracy of RDW to predict mortality
was similar in the two groups (ROC curve 0.697 for group A
and 0.711 for group B). Patients with higher RDW had also a
lower RI but similar levels of haptoglobin when compared to
Among critically ill patients RBCT were associated with
higher RDW but this did not influence the prognostic value of RDW.
High RDW values could not be secondary to an increased erythro-
poiesis, as suggested by low RI.
Reasons for admission in the paediatric intensive care unit and the
need for blood and blood products transfusions
E. Chochliourou, E. Volakli, A. Violaki, E. Samkinidou, G. Evlavis,
Hippokration General Hospital Thessaloniki, Thessaloniki, Greece
‡ = p < 0,05 compared to the other group
